test-case.name: variable-0108
test-case.description: Generated by NiceXSL 2.0.4 at Fri Apr 23 12:53:23 BST 2004 From Ed Willink: a stylesheet that shows problems in memory management. In 7.9.1, with looped=false, it gradually consumes memory, building a long list of Closure objects chained to other Closure objects a value of 200 or 1000 is more interesting from the point of view of memory management <xsl:param name="these-spans"/> <xsl:param name="annotated-spans"/>

test-case.name: variable-1001
test-case.description: Purpose: Set variable by name but no value, should get null string Note: "If the variable-binding element has empty content and does not have a select attribute, then the value of the variable is an empty string."

test-case.name: variable-1002
test-case.description: Section: 11.3 Using Variables and Parameters with xsl:copy-of Purpose: Test for using xsl:copy-of with empty (null string) variable.

test-case.name: variable-1003
test-case.description: Section: 11.4 Top-level Variables and Parameters Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (even when template referencing it is in the imported file)

test-case.name: variable-1004
test-case.description: Purpose: Set top-level xsl:param to a string

test-case.name: variable-1005
test-case.description: Purpose: Variable name is a QName.

test-case.name: variable-1006
test-case.description: Purpose: Set variable to null string explicitly and implicitly, compare.

test-case.name: variable-1007
test-case.description: Section: 11.2 Values of Variables and Parameters Purpose: Set a variable to a boolean, and show it being used in xsl:if

test-case.name: variable-1008
test-case.description: Section: 11.3 Using Variables and Parameters with xsl:copy-of Purpose: Test for using xsl:copy-of with variable set to a number. This should have the same result as xsl:value-of, stringified number.

test-case.name: variable-1009
test-case.description: Purpose: Set a variable inside a template based on variable defined earlier in that template. Two sets of quotes make it a string

test-case.name: variable-1010
test-case.description: Purpose: Use param whose name is a QName in with-param passing.

test-case.name: variable-1011
test-case.description: Set a variable within an if within a for-each.

test-case.name: variable-1012
test-case.description: Purpose: Show that name of variable acts like a real QName.

test-case.name: variable-1101
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for handling of RTF used as positional index by setting variable as the content of the xsl:variable element. Reference as [$n]. This is the case that will NOT obtain what a naive person expects. Note: When a variable is used to select nodes by position, be careful not to do: <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> This will output the value of the first item element, because the variable n will be bound to a result tree fragment, not a number. Instead, do either <xsl:variable name="n" select="2"/> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> or <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[position()=$n]"/>

test-case.name: variable-1102
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for handling of RTF used as positional index by setting variable as the content of the xsl:variable element. Reference as [position()=$n] This is the case that will NOT obtain what the naive person expects. Note: When a variable is used to select nodes by position, be careful not to do: <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> This will output the value of the first item element, because the variable n will be bound to a result tree fragment, not a number. Instead, do either <xsl:variable name="n" select="2"/> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> or <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[position()=$n]"/>

test-case.name: variable-1103
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for handling of number used as positional index by setting variable using select attribute. Reference as [$n] Note: When a variable is used to select nodes by position, be careful not to do: <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> This will output the value of the first item element, because the variable n will be bound to a result tree fragment, not a number. Instead, do either <xsl:variable name="n" select="2"/> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[$n]"/> or <xsl:variable name="n">2</xsl:variable> ... <xsl:value-of select="item[position()=$n]"/>

test-case.name: variable-1201
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for setting a param using a choose

test-case.name: variable-1301
test-case.description: Purpose: Verify that a variable defined within a xsl:with-param content is scoped correctly. Idea sent in on xalan-dev list. We should recognize 'test' within the with-param statement. The named template 'foo' really plays no part here. , based on posting to xalan-dev list

test-case.name: variable-1401
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for-each inside xsl:variable

test-case.name: variable-1402
test-case.description: Purpose: Test for-each inside xsl:param

test-case.name: variable-1501
test-case.description: Purpose: Show that there is always a current node

test-case.name: variable-1601
test-case.description: Purpose: Test param being set to default in a named template. If we had a with-param here, we could change the value of "bar".

test-case.name: variable-1701
test-case.description: Purpose: Verify that a variable in an inner template can take on a new value "Only the innermost binding of a variable is visible." suppress empty lines

test-case.name: variable-1702
test-case.description: Purpose: Verify that a variable in a for-each can take on a new value MHK: this is legal in 2.0 but not in 1.0 suppress empty lines

result.assert-xml: <out>begin doc template, $var=level1 inside for-each, $var=first inside for-each, $var=second end doc template, $var=level1 </out>

test-case.name: variable-1801
test-case.description: Purpose: Test setting several parameters locally

test-case.name: variable-1901
test-case.description: Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (testing references from various import levels)

result.assert-xml: <out><final>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</final ><middle>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</middle ><main>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</main></out>

test-case.name: variable-1902
test-case.description: Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (testing references from various import levels)

result.assert-xml: <out><final>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</final ><middle>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</middle ><side>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</side ><main>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</main></out>

test-case.name: variable-1903
test-case.description: Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (first template from middle, then up/down/up)

result.assert-xml: <out><middle>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</middle ><main>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</main ><final>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</final ><main-again>main stylesheet, should have highest precedence</main-again></out>

test-case.name: variable-1904
test-case.description: Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (order of imports in this sheet matters)

result.assert-xml: <out><final>set in var29side, should have highest precedence</final ><side>set in var29side, should have highest precedence</side ><main>set in var29side, should have highest precedence</main ><side-again>set in var29side, should have highest precedence</side-again></out>

test-case.name: variable-1905
test-case.description: Purpose: Import precedence applies to top-level params (start at bottom; all use variable set in middle)

result.assert-xml: <out><final>value set in var30mid, should have highest precedence</final ><main>value set in var30mid, should have highest precedence</main ><middle>value set in var30mid, should have highest precedence</middle ><main-again>value set in var30mid, should have highest precedence</main-again></out>

test-case.name: variable-2001
test-case.description: Purpose: Test how big a string can be passed to a template. Set upper limit here put out one iteration of the name and a trailing space

test-case.description: Section: 11.2 Values of Variables and Parameters Purpose: Test the ability of variable to hold the result of document()

test-case.name: variable-2201
test-case.description: It is not an error to pass a parameter to a template that does not have an element for it, the parameter is simpily ignored. This is an error in XSLT 2.0 if the stylesheet specifies version=2.0, but not with version="1.0"

test-case.name: variable-2202
test-case.description: Purpose: It is not an error to pass a parameter to a template that does not have an element for it, the parameter is simpily ignored. This is an error in XSLT 2.0 if the stylesheet specifies version=2.0, but not with version="1.0"

test-case.description: Purpose: Test passing value from top-level param to top-level variable via value-of.

test-case.description: Use same-named variables in inner and outer scopes, where inner is a for-each loop. MHK: legal in 2.0, illegal in 1.0

test-case.description: Purpose: Set cascaded top-level variables in arbitrary order.

test-case.name: variable-3001
test-case.description: Section: 11.2 Values of Variables and Parameters Purpose: Test proper construction of an RTF containing multiple top level nodes. Creator: Felix Garcia Romero (felixgr@tdi.tudistrito.es)

result.assert-xml: First element Second element

test-case.name: variable-3101
test-case.description: Purpose: Evaluation of params with repeated use of imported stylesheet. Creator: Matthew Hanson (matthew.hanson@wcom.com Elaboration: One of the params passed in to baseTemplate is the result of a call to baseSubTemplate. Both are in the imported stylesheet, which could be considered a subroutine library. The ...Param0 params aren't actually used, but are there to potentially cause trouble. baseTemplate puts out two child elements, one from itself and one it got from baseSubTemplate.

test-case.description: Purpose: Check propagation of params down into templates
